Had a great couple of days in Otis Elevator Co. ACE event.. Thanks to Luis Pinel and Team for leading us through the exercise.. - SW
Technical Director - Virtual Reality, Augmented Reality

⦁	Developed the core cross-platform software (Android, x86, ARM and UWP) for video conferencing and remote guidance with smart glasses across a range of AR glasses like the ODG, Epson Moverio, VUZIX, UWP, and Hololens.⦁	Developed a secure proprietary distribution app on Android for ITAR controlled VR apps.⦁	Provide hands-on technical direction and coaching during analysis, design, development, testing, implementation and post-implementation phases of VR projects.⦁	Developed demos and prototypes to showcase the latest VR, AR and Mixed Reality technologies.⦁	Established a solid project framework and development process for VR/AR endeavors.⦁	Work closely with teams to effectively coordinate complex design interdependencies.⦁	Work effectively and cross-functionally with all levels of management.⦁	Act as go-to person for competitive intelligence questions from all internal departments.⦁	Raise the bar on functionality, usability, and simplicity to drive an excellent customer experience.⦁	Manage milestones and deliverables, ensuring that they are on time and of the highest quality.⦁	Make proposals for new VR/AR development based on market research, trends and innovation.⦁	Inspire colleagues to continuously generate forward-thinking ideas and actively contribute to a culture of innovation and excellence.  Help build on Inhance's creative legacy and award-winning work.
Lead R&D Engineer - VR, 3D Computer Graphics

Bring hardware-accelerated interactive realtime 3D computer graphics to the web and portable devices like the Oculus Rift and Gear VR using OpenGL, C++, Java, Android NDK, JNI, Javascript, WebGL, and GLSL. Design and develop a real-time core graphics engine on the PC using Modern OpenGL and C++. Display 15+ million polycount models with per pixel Cook-Torrance lighting, HDR and anti-aliasing at an interactive frame rate. Support normal maps, PCF shadows, depth of field, and screen space ambient occlusion with deferred lighting for multiple positional and spot light sources. Develop Android native apps for the Samsung Gear VR using Android NDK and/or Unreal Engine 4Develop applications for the Oculus Rift headset with Unreal Engine 4 and/or UnityCreate Hybrid Android apps using Cordova and Crosswalk's webview.     Create software for artists to have real time GPU accelerated previews while creating content in a DCC platform.Design and develop a pipeline for transferring digital assets and animations from DCC softwares into WebGL with drag and drop functionality and multi-touch. Interface WebGL programs with VR headsets.

Directed and Co-Produced a feature film - ATROPHY (previously named PARANOIA). Internationally distributed through TomCat Films. Available in the US Domestic market through Amazon.com and Barnes and Noble book stores.
Design and develop embedded software tests for Mobility Radeon 9000 line of graphics cards.

Develop a compression algorithm for data transfer from the On-Board Software for the Apache Longbow, Chinook and Blackhawk helicopters to the Ground Based Station. Software is in C++ on VxWorks platform.

summary: Bivas has worked as a Software Engineer/Consultant on mission critical projects (ITAR, DO-178B) as well as commercial applications in the Aerospace/Defense industry. He is an Engineering Fellow at the Manpower group and has worked as a Computer Scientist for US Defense projects through Honeywell Aerospace. He has a Masters Degree in Computer Science from Arizona State University. Bivas was awarded a certificate of achievement in Software Engineering for his work on 3D Computer Graphics and Display Subsystems for commercial jetliners and Unmanned Aerial Vehicles. Bivas is equally passionate about the Arts. He has financed, produced and co-produced 3 feature films and has directed a feature. In 2008, he was awarded the Arizona Filmmaker of the Year by the Phoenix Film Festival, and was named as The Best Local Filmmaker by the Best of Phoenix magazine. He is a SAG-AFTRA actor with leading roles in independent features. During his free time he composes music and mentors college students and adults on their career path in the tech industry. He has over 600 hours of teaching experience with programming languages like C++, Java, Javascript, OpenGL, WebGL, Android, Unity and Unreal Engine
